IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Giving children back their childhood by providing care, both mental and physical, for children and families in need.
IRS990.Description: The organization provides services for HUNDREDs of children who are awaiting adoption, between the ages of infancy to 17 years old and represent a variety of ethnic backgrounds. The parental rights of these children have been severed through the court system or relinquished by the birth parents. These children rely on their relatives, foster families, or potential adoptive families they have never met who open their hearts and homes to create a "forever family". In addition to adopt-only homes, the organization also offers families the option of becoming foster-to-adopt homes.

Activity2.Description: The organization provides treatment to children ages 8 to 18 to address their behavioral and psychiatric issues that prevent them from living in a family setting. The organization offers the only equine therapy and expressive art therapy treatment center in Kansas, located in Dodge City and Newton. Children attend school and participate in highly structured, intensive therapy.

Activity3.Description: The organization provides a home and loving family for almost 1,600 children in Kansas, licensing more than 350 foster families throughout Kansas. Foster parents provide basic care for children such as shelter, food, clothing, and medical care. They also provide nurturing and discipline. Foster parents provide all the things any parent would provide to a child. Foster parents must be 21 or older, single or married, in good general physical and mental health, financially able to provide for their own families, own or rent a house or an apartment that can meet licensing requirements, and be able to pass child abuse background checks.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: The organizations political activities consist of the use of a lobbyist at the State Capitol to keep the organization informed of pending legislations, but they do not use the lobbyist to influence votes on any particular bills.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Other Expenses not on Tax return
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Consolidated audited financial statements were prepared. Total expenses as reported on those financials included expenses of; $93 for Child Welfare Resource Center and $375 for UMY Foundation.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Policies are reviewed annually, each Board member is asked to complete and sign a form regarding their relationship with other organizations.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The board chair and executive board committee evaluate, determine and negotiate compensation directly with our CEO. Human Resources does conduct an annual or bi-annual executive salary study to evaluate compensation which is provided to our CEO and BOD as requested. This past year compensation information from national, regional and local peer agencies was analyzed ensuring a mix of sources included both profit and non-profit organizations that compare to our scope of services, revenue, FTE, and COL. A determination to meet, lead or lag the market for each position along with individual equity was evaluated and recommendations were all provided along with the above mentioned salary study to our CEO.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Other Documents available to the Public
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Governing Documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements are available upon request to the organization. The CEO OR CFO is then notified, who then provides the requested information.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B LINE 11A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS SENT TO THE CHAIR OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE (OFFICERS AND BOARD) FOR REVIEW BEFORE BEING SUBMITTED TO THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.
